Package edu.cpp.cs.cs241.project3

Class UI

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs241.project3.UI
  • public class UI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the user interface that is to be used in the program. Objects of this class are instantiated with a prompt message, which is the main message to be used regularly to prompt the user. The main functionality of this class is to add options into the user interface in order to set up what this class is looking for when receiving input from the user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UI​(java.lang.String promptMessage)
      Constructs a new UI object with the given prompt message.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UI

        public UI​(java.lang.String promptMessage)
        Constructs a new UI object with the given prompt message.
        Parameters:
        promptMessage - A string that will be used when prompting the user, typically for an input.

    • Method Detail

      • addOption

        public void addOption​(char optLetter,
                      java.lang.String description)
        Adds a new option to this user interface. Take caution that duplicate options are allowed and may cause the interface to malfunction. Duplicate options are defined as two options that have the same option letter.
        Parameters:
        optLetter - The character to represent this option.
        description - A string that describes what this option pertains to.

      • promptUser

        public void promptUser()
        Prints out the prompt message that this user interface was first instantiated with.

      • printHelp

        public void printHelp()
        Prints out all the options available to the user along with their descriptions.

      • printPrompt

        public void printPrompt​(java.lang.String output)
        Prints out the given prompt to the user.
        Parameters:
        output - The prompt to output to the user.

      • printToScreen

        public void printToScreen​(java.lang.String output)
        Prints the given string to the screen.
        Parameters:
        output - The string to print out to the screen.

      • printError

        public void printError​(java.lang.String message)
        Prints the error message to the screen.
        Parameters:
        message - An error to print out to the screen.

      • getUserCommand

        public char getUserCommand()
        Gets a command from the user. This method will appropriately print out error messages for invalid inputs from the user until a valid one is given.
        Returns:
        One of characters that represent the options in this user interface, in lower case.

      • getUserInput

        public java.lang.String getUserInput​(int inputsNeeded)
        Gets inputs from the user, according to the given number of inputs needed. For example, if the number of inputs needed is 1, then this interface will keep prompting the user for a valid input until one single token is given. An empty string is returned when the number of inputs needed is specified as zero.
        Parameters:
        inputsNeeded - Number of inputs (tokens) needed from the user.
        Returns:
        An empty string for zero inputs needed, otherwise the user's raw input.
